node.title: Woman busted after admitting to a crime in her sleep
node.description: Her husband reported her to the police after being woken up by her sleep talking.
node.content: ["Man abhorrent to hear his wife stole thousands from a vulnerable person after he hears her sleeptalk about money.", "According to the Mirror, Ruth Fort, 47, stole $7000 from a wheelchair-bound woman she was meant to be looking after at a care home in Merseyside.", "Her husband, Antony, 61, became suspicious after she splurged thousands during a holiday in Mexico, but four weeks later his suspicions became true when he woke up to his wife talking about money, the Mirror said.", "Her husband then found the care home resident's debit card in her purse", "\"I had my suspicions when Ruth began over-spending. It was more of an instinct really, at first. But when I found the debit card in her purse, I just knew. It was heart-breaking,\" the Mirror reported Antony said.", "\"I loved Ruth deeply, but I could not ignore what she had done. It was abhorrent to me that she could steal from a vulnerable person and I had to report her.\"", "Ruth had told him previously that she had taken the resident out shopping and said the woman had almost $100,000 in her bank account.", "\"Something in the way she spoke just made my heart sink. I realised Ruth must have access to the card and pin number,\" Liverpool Echo reported Antony said.", "He reported her to the police and Ruth appeared before Liverpool Crown Court."]
